00023 //
00024 // These are the functions that a JIT built as a DLL must export for
00025 // the purpose of runtime interaction.
00026 //
00027 
00028 #ifndef _JIT_EXPORT_RT_H
00029 #define _JIT_EXPORT_RT_H
00030 
00031 
00032 #include "open/types.h"
00033 #include "jit_export.h"

00042 // begin Frame Contexts for JITs
00043 
00044 #ifdef _IPF_
00045 
00046 // Note that the code in transfer context is very depend upon the ordering of fields in this structure.
00047 // Be very careful in changing this structure.
00048 typedef
00049 struct JitFrameContext {
00050     uint64 *p_ar_pfs;
00051     uint64 *p_eip;
00052     uint64 sp;
00053     uint64 *p_gr[128];
00054     uint64 *p_fp[128];
00055     uint64 preds;
00056     uint64 *p_br[8];
00057     uint64 nats_lo;
00058     uint64 nats_hi;
00059     Boolean is_ip_past;
00060     uint64 ar_fpsr;
00061     uint64 ar_unat;
00062     uint64 ar_lc;
00063 } JitFrameContext; //JitFrameContext
00064 
00065 #elif defined _EM64T_
00066 
00067 typedef
00068 struct JitFrameContext {
00069     uint64   rsp;
00070     uint64 * p_rbp;
00071     uint64 * p_rip;
00072 
00073     // Callee-saved registers
00074     uint64 * p_rbx;
00075     uint64 * p_r12;
00076     uint64 * p_r13;
00077     uint64 * p_r14;
00078     uint64 * p_r15;
00079     
00080     // The scratch registers are currently only valid during GC enumeration.
00081     uint64 * p_rax;
00082     uint64 * p_rcx;
00083     uint64 * p_rdx;
00084     uint64 * p_rsi;
00085     uint64 * p_rdi;
00086     uint64 * p_r8;
00087     uint64 * p_r9;
00088     uint64 * p_r10;
00089     uint64 * p_r11;
00090 
00091     // To restore processor flags during transfer
00092     uint32 eflags;
00093 
00094     Boolean is_ip_past;
00095 } JitFrameContext;
00096 
00097 #else // "_IA32_"
00098 
00099 typedef
00100 struct JitFrameContext {
00101     uint32 esp;
00102     uint32 *p_ebp;
00103     uint32 *p_eip;
00104 
00105     // Callee-saved registers
00106     uint32 *p_edi;
00107     uint32 *p_esi;
00108     uint32 *p_ebx;
00109 
00110     // The scratch registers are currently only valid during GC enumeration.
00111     uint32 *p_eax;
00112     uint32 *p_ecx;
00113     uint32 *p_edx;
00114 
00115     // To restore processor flags during transfer
00116     uint32 eflags;
00117 
00118     Boolean is_ip_past;
00119 } JitFrameContext;
00120 
00121 #endif // "_IA32_"
00122 
00123 typedef void * InlineInfoPtr;
00124 
00125 // end Frame Contexts for JITs

00128 
00129 
00131 // begin direct call support
00132 
00133 
00134 // The following are optional functions used by the direct call-related JIT interface. 
00135 // These functions are implemented by a JIT and invoked by the VM. They allow a JIT 
00136 // to be notified whenever, e.g., a VM data structure changes that would require 
00137 // code patching or recompilation.
00138  
00139 // The callback that corresponds to vm_register_jit_extended_class_callback.  
00140 // The newly loaded class is new_class.  The JIT should return TRUE if any code was modified
00141 // (consequently the VM will ensure correctness such as synchronizing I- and D-caches), 
00142 // and FALSE otherwise.
00143 JITEXPORT Boolean 
00144 JIT_extended_class_callback(JIT_Handle jit, 
00145                             Class_Handle  extended_class,
00146                             Class_Handle  new_class,
00147                             void         *callback_data);
00148 
00149 // The callback that corresponds to vm_register_jit_overridden_method_callback. 
00150 // The overriding method is new_method. The JIT should return TRUE if any code was modified
00151 // (consequently the VM will ensure correctness such as synchronizing I- and D-caches),
00152 // and FALSE otherwise.
00153 JITEXPORT Boolean 
00154 JIT_overridden_method_callback(JIT_Handle jit,
00155                                Method_Handle  overridden_method,
00156                                Method_Handle  new_method, 
00157                                void          *callback_data);
00158 
00159 // The callback that corresponds to vm_register_jit_recompiled_method_callback.  
00160 // The JIT should return TRUE if any code was modified (consequently the VM will ensure 
00161 // correctness such as synchronizing I- and D-caches), and FALSE otherwise.
00162 JITEXPORT Boolean 
00163 JIT_recompiled_method_callback(JIT_Handle jit,
00164                                Method_Handle  recompiled_method,
00165                                void          *callback_data); 
00166 
00167 
00168 // end direct call support
00170 
00171

00186                                   JitFrameContext* context
00187                                   );
00188 
00189 JITEXPORT void

00191                                   Method_Handle          method,
00192                                   GC_Enumeration_Handle  enum_handle,
00193                                   JitFrameContext* context
00194                                   );
00201 JITEXPORT uint32 
00202 JIT_get_inline_depth(JIT_Handle jit, 
00203                      InlineInfoPtr   ptr, 
00204                      uint32          offset);

00217 JITEXPORT Method_Handle

00219                        InlineInfoPtr ptr, 
00220                        uint32 offset,
00221                        uint32 inline_depth);

00258 // begin compressed references
00259 
00260 
00261 // Returns TRUE if the JIT will compress references within objects and vector elements by representing 
00262 // them as offsets rather than raw pointers. The JIT should call the VM function vm_references_are_compressed()
00263 // during initialization in order to decide whether it should compress references.
00264 JITEXPORT Boolean 
00265 JIT_supports_compressed_references(JIT_Handle jit);
